snippet: A memo to umpires essentially said that if a runner is clearly out, and would have been so regardless of the catcher’s positioning, he will now remain out.
abstract: MLB urges umpires to apply common sense to new rule on home plate collisions that has confounded players and fans; calls based on strict interpretation of rule have often overturned plays in which runner would clearly have been out.
lead_paragraph: A memo to umpires essentially said that if a runner is clearly out, and would have been so regardless of the catcher’s positioning, he will now remain out.
